result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard A. Boardman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County cases 16CF45 and 15CF166

superMiscConds.notes:
plus 10% restitution surcharge.
Amount to be determined (for reinstallation/repair costs).
Restitution hearing may be held if amount is close to $10,000 replacement cost.

No contact with S.S. or L.P.
No contact with M.S., C.S., or E29775 Tioga Rd in Town of Fairchild.
No contact with R.B. or his residence or property.

Provide complete and truthful statement regarding the theft of the wood furnace in 15CF887 and those involved.
Testify truthfully at any hearings/trials involving others; truthfulness may be verified by ECPD polygraph, if requested.
Comply with any counseling/conditions/programming/treatment per agent.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.
